DOC.brief_title: Acute Effects Dietary Fats Carbohydrate Subjects With Metabolic Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: A randomized , double-blind , crossover design study conduct test acute effect high fat meal enrich ( 1 ) saturate fatty acid ( SFA ) ; ( 2 ) monounsaturated fatty acid ( MUFA ) ; ( 3 ) polyunsaturated fatty acid ( PUFA ) vs. ( 4 ) low fat/high carbohydrate ( CARB ) meal postprandial insulinaemic , lipaemic inflammatory response , well gastrointestinal peptide secretion satiation 30 metabolic syndrome subject ( 15 men 15 woman ) . Primary outcome study postprandial change C-peptide . Other measure outcome include insulin glucose response , lipid , cytokine gastrointestinal peptide . Subjective appetite measurement take exploratory outcome use visual analogue scale . Subjects ask participate four postprandial challenge , separate least one week . On day precede postprandial intervention , subject provide low fat meal ( < 10 g ) consume even meal . They require fast night 10 pm arrive research unit 7:30 - 9:00 follow morning . Fasting blood sample collect subject instruct consume allocate test meal within 10 minute . Further venous blood collect regular interval 6 hour postprandially . During 6 hour experimental study , subject refrain consumption food drink except plain water ask consume regular interval ( 750 mL 6 hour ) .
DOC.criteria: Age 20 60 Elevated TAG least 1.7 mmol/L Low HDL cholesterol ( < 1.04 mmol/L men , 1.3 mmol/L woman ) Elevated blood pressure ( systolic least 130 , diastolic least 85 mmHg ) Increased waist circumference ( least 90cm men , 80cm woman ) Fasting plasma glucose 5.6 7.0 mmol/L Underweight Current use antihypertensive lipid lower medication Alcohol intake exceed moderate intake ( > 28 unit per week ) Medical history myocardial infarction , angina , thrombosis , stroke , cancer diabetes Pregnancy breastfeed Smoker
